instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting integrated SSD after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
Hi again.
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that does not detect the internal SSD.
This unit was apparently water damaged.
Another technician cleaned the board, unfortunately, so I cannot see where the liquid got onto the board.
There are no signs of corrosion anywhere.

Booting from a Monterey boot disk, disk utility fails to see the SSD.

I have cleaned and re-seated the metal plate on J9600, which appears absolutely clean.
<SIGNAL>SSD_PGOOD_L</SIGNAL> is 1.76v
I have tested all SSD voltages on page 84, all are exactly as they should be.

Edit. I tried heating the SSD NANDs and controller, as per recommendations on another post here, without any change.

Any other suggestions greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting integrated SSD after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
Possibly ripped off components, if machine was in other repair shop before.
If all SSD power rails are good, then some signal could be bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting integrated SSD after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
Thanks again 2informaticos.
Sorry for the delay.
I had covid and was away from work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting integrated SSD after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
I hope you are OK now.
